places.generalDescription: The Royal Armouries Museum is a captivating destination that showcases the rich history of arms and armor in a modern setting. Nestled on a revitalized 13-acre dockland site just 15 minutes from the city center, this National Museum boasts an impressive collection that dates back to the reign of Elizabeth I.

sources.snippet: The Royal Armouries Museum in Leeds is one of the best places to visit in the city, offering incredibly interesting displays that are sure to intrigue you, even if you‚Äôre not an avid historian. With over 4,500 objects on display across five different floors, this purpose-built museum has plenty to see, showcasing weapons and armour from across the ages. The spectacular displays are a sight to behold, especially the incredible Hall of Steel.
sources.shortName: 10 Romantic Things to Do in Leeds for Couples (2024)

sources.snippet: On the banks of the River Aire, the Royal Armouries Museum allows you to learn about the fascinating and sometimes grisly history of arms and armour from all over the world. The hall of steel holds an impressive collection of 2,500 items, with an angled mirror that lets you get a great view without getting a crick neck.
sources.shortName: Things to do in Leeds City Centre for Couples

sources.snippet: Or, for a unique daytime experience, take a trip to the Royal Armouries Museum to discover fascinating displays of arms and armour from around the world. These daytime activities are perfect for couples looking to immerse themselves in the city‚Äôs heritage before an evening of indulgence.

places.name: Royal Armouries Museum

reviews.text:
The Royal Armouries in Leeds is a fascinating place to visit, packed with exhibits that take you back through history. There's so much to see and learn-it can easily take a few hours to explore properly. Throughout the day, there are live shows and demonstrations which are not only educational but also fun, with audience participation that really brings the experience to life.

It's an engaging place for all ages, and my son particularly enjoyed it. It's a great day out for families, offering insight into the history and cultures of different parts of the world.

One downside is the caf√©, which is on the pricey side. You might be better off walking down the road to find something more affordable to eat.

Overall, a memorable and educational trip that's well worth the visit.

Absolutely fabulous museum, so much to do and see.

So much history in this museum, with live reenactments that help children understand how it may have been in the past.

Huge displays!
The stairwell was epic-with swords, pikes, spears and armour.
Interactive displays.
Even an full sized armoured elephant and horses!

A fun photo op as you enter, a chance to take your picture with a dragon, holding on to a sword as if to slay it.

We plan to visit the museum again when we can take more time over the exhibits and enjoy their other live performances.

A wonderful place to visit.
Free entry.
Lots and lots of exhibitions covering  many centuries.
We spent  couple of hours in here but needed much longer.
It's really well spaced out, so even though it was busy it wasn't cramped.
Air con was very welcome.
Kids loved the show that was on.
Lots and lots to do and see and it's set at leeds dock which is also a fab place to visit

places.generalDescription: Roundhay Park is a stunning expanse of nature nestled in Leeds, drawing nearly a million visitors annually. This expansive parkland boasts beautiful gardens, serene lakes, and winding walking trails that invite exploration. Families can enjoy two playgrounds and various sports fields, making it an ideal spot for outdoor activities. The park is also known for hosting vibrant festivals and open-air concerts throughout the year, adding to its lively atmosphere.

sources.snippet: It houses tropical plants and animals from around the world and is second only to Kew Gardens in the UK. The huge greenhouses are a great way to spend an afternoon and mean you can enjoy nature even on a rainy day.

sources.snippet: At more than 700 acres, Roundhay Park is absolutely massive. One visit isn‚Äôt enough to see it all ‚Äì in fact, neither are 10 visits. With loads of parkland, woods, lakes and more to see, you can make a day of it.

places.name: Roundhay Park

reviews.text:
Roundhay Park is absolutely brilliant ‚Äì one of the best city parks I've ever visited. It's massive, beautifully maintained, and has something for everyone. The lakes, woodlands, and wide open green spaces make it perfect for walks, picnics, or just relaxing outdoors.

We spent a good few hours wandering around and still didn't see it all. The walk around Waterloo Lake was especially lovely, with ducks and swans, and loads of scenic spots to stop and take in the view. The Tropical World nearby is also well worth a visit if you've got kids or just fancy something a bit different.

Great facilities too ‚Äì plenty of parking, clean toilets, and cafes dotted around for a coffee or snack. Whether you're local or just visiting Leeds, Roundhay Park is a must-see. A proper breath of fresh air right on the city's doorstep.

Roundhay Park is a beautiful green space at the heart of the community. The park has something for everyone ‚Äì from wide open areas to relax, to fun attractions like the land train ride and play parks for children. The lake is perfect for a stroll, and feeding the ducks is always a favourite. There's a lovely caf√© overlooking the water, and you'll often find an ice cream van nearby on sunny days. The park also hosts a variety of events throughout the year, including fairs and food festivals, which make every visit feel different and exciting. A vibrant and welcoming place

Nice area with cafes, walks, cricket pitch and a land train. Area was really clean (almost no litter) and the paths were fairly good; more than good enough for pushchairs and wheelchairs. Also the Monet Garden and HESCO garden which were lovely too.

places.generalDescription: The Grand Theatre & Opera House Leeds is a stunning venue that showcases the best of performing arts in the city. Known for its classical architecture, this theatre serves as a home for Opera North's captivating productions and various touring shows. Visitors are often enchanted by its elegant design and rich history, making it a must-visit destination for culture enthusiasts. The theatre not only hosts operas but also features an array of performances throughout the year, ensuring there's always something exciting happening on stage.

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre trying to impress someone with a love of theatre, why not splash out and book a private box at the Grand Theatre?. What could be more romantic than watching a play, musical or comedic performance from the comfort and luxury of your own private booth?

sources.snippet: One of the most romantic things to do in Leeds for couples is to have a date night out at the breathtaking Grand Theatre in the centre of the city. With a diverse range of offerings including plays, musicals, and comedy shows, the Theatre caters to everyone‚Äôs taste so you can pick the perfect choice of entertainment that you‚Äôll both enjoy. The theatre has been providing entertainment to visitors and residents of Leeds since 1878 and continues today, hosting an incredible array of shows including touring West End productions.
sources.shortName: 10 Romantic Things to Do in Leeds for Couples (2024)

sources.snippet: You'll be guaranteed a grand night out together at the Leeds Grand Theatre and Opera House. It is the home of Opera North and the Northern Ballet, so if you and your loved one enjoy classical opera and ballet, this is the place to visit. However, don't think this is a theatre just for "highbrow" entertainment - they also have blockbuster shows and musicals, so it's worth checking what is on at the Grand!

Situated on New Briggate, the theatre is an architectural gem, offering a diverse array of performances, including musicals, plays, and operas. It‚Äôs the perfect venue for couples who appreciate the arts and are looking for an elegant and sophisticated evening out.

There‚Äôs always something on, so whatever you and your other half like to catch on stage, you‚Äôre bound to find it. The theatre routinely hosts musicals, comedians, musicians, plays and more.

places.name: The Grand Theatre & Opera House Leeds

reviews.text:
Lovely period theatre
Views very good from most aspects. Bar and snacks available. Staff attentive and polite
Visit for Al Murray Guv island tour thoroughly enjoyed the evening

I went to the theater on my own, which was incredibly hard. I lost my wife to cancer just 6 months ago, and this is the kind of show she would have absolutely adored. We always loved going to different shows together, and I made a promise to her-to keep doing the things we loved, to keep living for the both of us.

I watched Kinky Boots which was an absolute triumph ‚Äì a show that's as bold and beautiful as it is moving and meaningful. From the moment the lights came up, I was completely captivated. The performances were phenomenal, the energy electric, and the story ‚Äì oh, the story ‚Äì struck right to the heart.

As a member of the LGBTQ community, this show resonated with me on such a personal level. I cried ‚Äì not just at the emotional depth of the narrative, but because I saw parts of my own journey, as well as those of friends reflected on stage. The struggle for acceptance, the sting of rejection, the courage it takes to be unapologetically yourself ‚Äì it was all there, handled with such authenticity, grace, and heart.

But what truly makes Kinky Boots so special is how it blends this deep emotional core with joy, humour, and hope. It's laugh-out-loud funny at times, wonderfully cheeky, and endlessly heartwarming. It reminds you that love, understanding, and acceptance really can change the world ‚Äì one step at a time, in a fabulous pair of heels.

This wasn't just a show ‚Äì it was a celebration of identity, resilience, and community. A standing ovation doesn't do it justice. If you have the chance to see it, do. It's a powerful, affirming, and unforgettable experience.

Sitting there alone was extremely painful, and I felt an overwhelming sadness when I arrived, missing my wife beside me so deeply. I cried quietly in the darkness, not just because of the show's moving moments, but because she wasn't there to share them.

But somehow, through the laughter, the music, and the message of hope and acceptance, the show gently lifted my spirits. It reminded me that joy can still be found, even through the grief, and for that, I'm truly grateful.

The cast of performers are fabulous! And the show made me miss going to drag shows with my sweet wife. We loved those!

The theatre itself is lovely. It has a real sense of character. Its period features and traditional charm give it a warm, welcoming feel, and the architecture adds a touch of elegance to the whole experience. The kind of place that adds to the enjoyment of the evening without overshadowing the performance itself.

Overall, a fantastic experience.

I've even booked myself a ticket to the Sounds of 60s show! And yes, alone but I can do this!

My daughter and I went to see Six the Musical, I have mobility issues, and all the staff were very attentive, and helpful. Some of the other theatre users were also helpful and patient.
The show its self was amazing and my daughter is still on cloud ‚òÅÔ∏è 9.
Thank you all for a wonderful experience.

places.generalDescription: Temple Newsam is a magnificent historic mansion located just southeast of Leeds city center, surrounded by lush parkland and a working farm. This grand residence boasts an impressive collection of priceless art and antiques, showcasing the rich cultural heritage of the area. Visitors can explore beautifully landscaped grounds designed by Capability Brown in the 18th century, as well as formal parterre gardens that add to its charm.

sources.snippet: Temple Newsam, one of the romantic places to go in Leeds, is a historic site with vast grounds and gardens where you two can take a stroll. Take in its 500-year-deep history all recounted in its glorious 1,500-acres (607-hectares) mansion ground. The temple‚Äôs walls ‚Äî where royalty once walked ‚Äî are full of history.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Romantic Things To Do In Leeds, England

sources.snippet: A combination of outstanding architecture and visually stunning grounds surrounding the manor house, farm lakes and gardens make Temple Newsam a romantic hot spot for a walking date. The history runs deep at Temple Newsam. The estate is shrouded in mystery, love, peace and war.

sources.snippet: Inject some adrenaline into your date with Go Ape at Temple Newsam. This adventure park offers an exhilarating treetop experience with high-flying ziplines and daring free falls. It‚Äôs an ideal choice for adventurous couples looking to challenge themselves and build trust.

places.name: Temple Newsam

reviews.text: A very interesting and impressive house.  There is lots to see and learn about the history of Temple Newsam. Pretty gardens, with carpets of snowdrops and crocuses. Lovely place to go for a walk. Parking is ¬£1 for two hours, but it is card only; which can be awkward when your card is not accepted.

Beautiful flowers in the walled garden at Temple Newsam!
The greenhouse is currently closed for refurbishment, however there's lots of vibrant colours on display in the gardens.
Enjoyed the daily special in the tearoom for ¬£6.99, which was a southern fried chicken salad with sweet chilli sauce. They also serve a good range of sandwiches, jacket potatoes and cakes. Plenty of seating indoors and outdoors in the courtyard.
Always a nice place to wander around for an hour or two!

We really enjoyed our visit to the farm at Temple Newsam. There were plenty of animals to see (including little piglets, lambs and kids), plus plenty of historical information about the farm and equipment that was used to run it years ago. We didn't go inside the house, and the gardens weren't very exciting due to the time of year (March), but it was absolutely worth a visit for the animals and then having ice cream afterwards.

places.generalDescription: Step into the world of retro gaming at Arcade Club Leeds, where visitors can relive the glory days of arcade gaming from the 1970s, 1980s, and 1990s. This haven for game enthusiasts offers unlimited access to Europe's largest video arcade with a vast collection of games spanning three floors. From classics like Pac-Man to modern virtual reality sets, there's something for everyone to enjoy.

sources.snippet: Arcade Club is your chance to show your partner who‚Äôs boss when it comes to Pac-Man. It‚Äôs three floors of video game heaven, with more than 300 arcade and pinball machines to play on. Think low lighting, brightly coloured LED lights and that iconic mish-mash of video game sounds.

reviews.text: This is the 2nd Arcade Club I've been to and it's just as good as the other one (in Bury) it's not as big as the one in Bury but the nostalgia and the amount of fun you have here is so good!!! I took my eldest daughter and we spent 8 hours here of non stop fun!! Makes you feel like a kid again!! And for the price is an absolute bargain!! We went to the arcades in my local town and it is a ¬£1-¬£2 a go on everything and within 10minutes I said good buy to ¬£20!!! Whereas the price for unlimited play is worth every penny!! The food and drink is a good price aswell!!! Whoever came up with this idea is a genius!! Keep up the good work and we will be back again soon!!! Only thing I want to say is‚Ä¶ PUT ONE OF THESE IN MY LOCAL AREA PLEASE!!!!

What an absolute great day, been a few times now and just love coming back. Been to this one and Bury and both are brilliant. Food good, excellent price I had a burger and eldest had pizza and it was very good. Staff are great and the place WOW!! we're do you start I was born 72 so all the games on floor 2 were my go to games in the 80s / 90s. If you haven't been or thinking of going it's a no brainier. Get urselves down it's brill.
Only 1 thing wrong and that's the fact Andy hasn't opened 1 in Sheffield Yet..
So get it sorted. üòÇüòÇ

3 floors that are absolutely full of arcade machines. Games from the 80's, 90's and now. We had an excellent time. You can spend all day there if you want for the admission price. The food was very cheap. Nothing special but nice enough for the price. Free, but limited, parking. You can park in the shopping centre car parks nearby. But for a limited time only. I think it's 2 hrs currently. I'm going back with a couple of friends who haven't been before very soon.

places.generalDescription: The Brudenell Social Club, originally a working men's club established in 1913, has been transformed into one of Leeds' most cherished venues. Despite retaining its original 1950s decor with carpeted floors and leather stools, it now hosts both well-known and emerging bands. The venue attracts a diverse crowd, from long-time locals to students dominating the Hyde Park area and anyone looking for affordable drinks.

sources.snippet: There are loads of great options, from City Varieties to Belgrave, but we can‚Äôt get enough of Brudenell Social Club. They have live music on pretty much every night of the week, whether it‚Äôs renowned international artists or up-and-coming local bands. Plus, they have a brilliant beer and crisp offering‚Ä¶ a pint of Virtuous and a bag of Scampi Fries is sure to woo even the most nervy of dates.
sources.shortName: 25 Undeniably Awesome Dates in Leeds

sources.snippet: Originally formed as a social and recreational club over 100-years ago; the Brudenell has evolved into a primary cog in Leeds music scene, and is a destination for live grassroots indie music. This lively and fun loving venue is the perfect date for any music fan!. The old working men‚Äôs club ‚Äì distinctly adorned with 1950s d√©cor ‚Äì hosts up and coming (and huge) bands.

sources.snippet: From the outside, Brudenell Social Club probably doesn‚Äôt look like the most romantic location in the world. But for music lovers, this might just be the perfect spot for a romantic Leeds date night. Brudenell is a legendary Leeds gig venue and has been host to some of the best gigs the city has ever seen.

places.name: Brudenell Social Club

reviews.text: Went to Dressed To Kill on the 26th of April. Even though they are a cover of KISS (one of the greatest bands ever), there is a reason why they've been doing it for 35 years. The venue itself was spacious enough, good sound setup, and decently priced drinks. Went there with my partner and a few friends and it's honestly one of the best nights out I've had in a while.
Saw my favourite band there. Amazing place, great friendly staff, almost unbelievably cheap prices. Great venue. Will look to see future gigs there.

Great venue for live music, having seen lots of bands here.  Great new extra stage, meaning they've doubled up on gigs, which is really needed in Leeds given that most of the live venues have closed down and the bigger venues charge an arm and a leg.  The staff are all friendly and the booze isn't ridiculously overpriced.  Sound quality is great and we'll definitely be returning.

places.generalDescription: Tharavadu is a renowned Keralan restaurant located in Leeds, offering a modern dining experience with traditional Indian cuisine. The restaurant has been recommended by the Michelin guide for three consecutive years and is known for its authentic Keralan dishes. The menu features a variety of options including meat, vegetarian, vegan, and gluten-free dishes. With floor-to-ceiling windows and polished wood floors, the venue provides a contemporary setting to enjoy South Indian flavors.

sources.snippet: What to have: Their traditional Thali‚Äôs are not to be missed. Tharavadu is a multi-award-winning restaurant in Leeds city centre where you will experience the flavours of traditional Keralan cuisine. As the first authentic Keralan restaurant in Leeds, Tharavadu became one of the favourite dining spots in Leeds, in a very short space of time.

reviews.text: Amazing good with such outstanding flavours. Creative presentation. Very professional way pf managing a very busy restaurant without fuss or delay but with complete calm. We were pressured unto buying an additional rice as the waitress thought we needed it and didn't listen to us but we didn't let it spoil the Amazing meal. We will definitely return next time we are in Leeds and would recommend this experience to anyone who loves good food

Went here on Saturday afternoon, 4:30pm
This is a restaurant, so I will start with the food. 10 out of 10 I couldn't fault anything.
The people are lovely.  I don't Complain, just for The sake of it, just so you don't think this person you just couldn't please.

In my opinion, I think they try and get as many people in, I sat for 15 minutes without even being asked if we wanted a drink, I actually had to wave to somebody in the end to get their attention.  They took our Drink and food order all in one go, The food arrived and we're just about finished our first drink. So we re-ordered the same drink order.
That never arrived, When we finished our food, I waved to somebody and said that our second drinks had not arrived, The lady couldn't of been any nicer, Very apologetic and said she would go get our drinks, She come back and said there was never ordered, We had finished our food, so we said never mind so we didn't have the second drink.
We was never asked if we wanted anything, We wasn't asked if the food was okay, The place was very full, In my opinion, not enough stuff on. Just need someone at the front of the house making sure everybody is okay with drinks, And if everybody's meal is okay.
And some of the staff smelt of BO so they should take that into account when Serving food.

We love South Indian food and were really looking forward to visiting Tharavadu having heard very good reports. We were not disappointed, everything was absolutely fantastic. Delicious food, good coffee afterwards, the place was buzzing, very friendly and efficient service. Definitely highly recommended.

places.generalDescription: Harewood House is an 18th-century stately home located in Harewood, Leeds. It boasts stunning Robert Adam-designed interiors, priceless art collections, and a beautifully landscaped garden. The house features antique furniture, historic paintings, ceramics, and a playground for children. Visitors can also explore the Bird Garden which houses over 90 different species, including some that are endangered or vulnerable.

sources.snippet: Situated close to the city, Harewood House is a captivating country estate boasting a rich history dating back to the late 18th century. A visit to Harewood House offers an enlightening tour, providing ample opportunities to delve into its fascinating past and the incredible art collection that can be found inside. Additionally, the estate features a farm experience where you can meet some of the resident animals, such as alpacas and pygmy goats!

sources.snippet: Spend the day with your other half and explore one of Yorkshire‚Äôs most magnificent country homes. Harewood‚Äôs picturesque landscape spans more than a thousand acres, with beautiful parkland, formal gardens and an exotic bird garden all on site for you to explore. Get acquainted with the penguins and flamingos that live on the property, before heading inside this fairytale-like house where you can admire an impressive collections of art.

sources.snippet: This 18th-century country estate belongs to David and Diane Lascelles, Earl and Countess of Harewood. You can visit the manor house with its lavishly decorated rooms as well as visiting the gardens which are the best part!. Feed the penguins in the bird sanctuary, admire the landscaped gardens and walk through acres of grounds on a long walk.

reviews.text: Very beautiful and well maintained house and gardens.  Please allow yourself plenty of time or arrive in the morning to do a much as you can.  The House closes at 3pm, the terrace cafe closes before 4pm but the Courtyard is open till 5pm, the ferry closes at 4pm and is not available weekdays.  The old church has no parking but there is a shuttle bus.  Lots of walking, gentle strolls, some places are hilly by the lakeside.  There is a free ferry ride to the Walled Garden.  There is a Children's Area, stroller / pushchair hire too.

Absolutely stunning grounds. The house is very interesting, quite a lot to see. It will take you approximately 30 minutes to an hour to go through the house. At the exit there is a little cafe where you can have a drink and cake. They don't serve much food, so don't be thinking to have lunch there.

The gardens and lake are stunning. You could spend half a day easily strolling and enjoying the grounds.

Negatives: toilets. Too few, old and dirty. Get them refurbished. The cafe was poor. Food was bland, overpriced. Tables dirty. Wasps everywhere - you need to control and get some bug zappers.

Ticket prices are extortionate. ¬£50+ for a couple. It's a bit ridiculous. Come on. It's definitely worth a visit, however, at this price I very very much doubt we will be back. The price is very off putting.

¬£26.50 per person entry fee, my fiancee is still in shock. However, the gardens and lake side walk are fantastic. We really enjoyed the woodland, and variety of plants and shrubs. Its clean, well presented  and can understand it being expensive to maintain. We spent around 3 hours walking the park, enjoying the stunning scenary, resting on the many benches, enjoying the refreshments on offer. (Most refreshments are reasonably priced. Apart from alcohol which is expensive.) Enjoyed the little boat crossing the lake. Found all staff approachable, helpful, and informative. They are a credit. We enjoyed walking around the house however would have preffered more information about each of the rooms, such as what they were originally used for. A bit more in depth history. Overall an enjoyable day out. Done it once so unlikely to return for a while due to the high pricing.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the charming suburb of Kirkstall, Leeds, Kirkstall Abbey is a stunning remnant of 12th-century architecture that transports visitors back to its vibrant past as a Cistercian monastery. Founded in 1152, this remarkable site showcases well-preserved ruins including the church and cloisters, offering an intriguing insight into medieval monastic life.

sources.snippet: Dive into more than 800 years of Leeds history by exploring the historic Kirkstall Abbey. This 12th-century ruin is one of the UK‚Äôs best-preserved Cistercian monasteries, which is free to access if you‚Äôre a Leeds local. If the two of you are into history, you‚Äôll definitely enjoy a trip to this stunning historical site.

sources.snippet: You can learn about its rich history at the visitors‚Äô center. Here you will learn about its deep history and how monks lead their lives. Run by the Cistercian Order, the Abbey also has vast parklands where you and your beloved can take strolls for as long as you want.

places.name: Kirkstall Abbey

reviews.text:
Absolute must see. This abbey dates back at least 800 years‚Ä¶. Absolutely incredible, such a beautiful place to visit. There's a museum as well although we ran out of time for that.
There's a cute coffee shop and souvenir shop as you enter.
It's by donation so pay what you feel fair.
Carpark is a short walk over the road from the abbey, opposite the small museum. Free parking.

Beautiful old ruin, impressive to see old roman indoor plumbing and construction. It's a great place for a wander and a picnic, especially on a sunny day.
The Abbey itself has paid entry, but it's quite cheap, though you can see most of it just by wandering around the fence, which isn't too far from the crumbling walls of the Abbey.
It's a beautiful place to visit.

Beautiful place for a wander on a sunny day! Parking outside the Museum for free. Entry is free but you will have to make a cash donation via terminal or use a traditional box. Toilets, a shop and a little snack shop at the entrance. You can have a picnic outside near a lovely river.

With an upcoming addition to their menu like the Char Sui Monkfish and an array of meaningful cocktails, Tattu Leeds offers a unique dining experience.

places.name: Tattu Leeds

reviews.text:
A great night out at Tattu Leeds

From the moment we walked in, we were really impressed. The place looks amazing - the decoration is beautiful and the whole vibe is perfect for a nice evening out (and great for photos too!).

The food was delicious, full of flavour and really well presented. But what made the whole experience even better was the service. Everyone was super friendly and welcoming, and they paid attention to all the little details without being over the top.

Shout out to Millie, who looked after us, she was fantastic. She knew the menu really well and took the time to explain things and make sure we felt comfortable with our choices. Really appreciated how patient and helpful she was.

All in all, it was a lovely experience and definitely good value for money. Would absolutely recommend and can't wait to go back!

Wonderful evening, food was incredible. Our waiter Ryan was very knowledgeable and super attentive. We had the tattu sharer, portions were very generous we came away with a doggy bag! Everything was so tasty. Cocktails are fun. Overall a really enjoyable night.

We had a lovely meal at Tattu. Wonderful food and really nicely presented. We had a set menu option with a starter and main. Portions were really generous and everything was super tasty. Of all the dishes we think the squid to start with was our favourite! Great wine list as well. Having just been on hols to Slovenia we choose a Slovenian wine which was lovely. Our server Ryan was fantastic and gave us some great recommendations. At the end of the meal our son had a lovely surprise dish to celebrate his graduation as well. All in all a great please to visit on a special occasion.

places.name: Belgrave Music Hall & Canteen

reviews.text: Food awesome, top selection of food truck choices of pizza, wings and burgers. Lamb pizza off the charts. Often queues but good things come to those who wait. Great beer, good selection of seating options from beer keller style tables, to sofas to rooftop booths. Family friendly during the day. DJ appears to be in all days, good tunes so good vibes, laughter and chats for all. From IPA to cocktails so good drinks choices at reasonable prices. Gig venue upstairs, compact but perfectly formed. Been to both standing and seated gigs. Never had a sofa for a gig before. A revelation!

Plant and Beef Patty was what we ordered‚Ä¶ went in on a Sunday and the ¬£5 for a patty was reasonable but maybe I won't recommend for a ¬£10. Also, veg one was good like melting cheese and saucy. Beef was not that great, more of salt and better cooked would have been good.

Good place to hangout with friends. There's a raised seating area in front of the photo booth that didn't make sense since it's just the table and the stools wasn't too comfortable of a seating.

A menu of the places on each table would have been nice or at least a link to a digital one if there is.

Attended the Rival Consoles gig here last week, and honestly surprised I haven't been here before.  Venue was a good size, had an excellent quality sound system and staff were all friendly.

Drinks prices seemed to be reasonable and downstairs area looked to be very busy and food smelled great!

places.generalDescription: Tropical World, located in Roundhay Park at the heart of Leeds City Centre, is a popular family attraction boasting the second largest collection of tropical plants in the UK after Kew Gardens. With over a million visitors annually, it offers an array of experiences for all ages. Visitors can explore greenhouses housing diverse tropical plant species and encounter various animals such as meerkats, lizards, mice, snakes, piranhas, crocodiles, butterflies, birds and bats.

It‚Äôs not too pricey at ¬£7.20 per adult, and you‚Äôll be treated to exhibits with animals ranging from monkeys to crocodiles and beyond. If you want to pretend you‚Äôre in an exotic tropical jungle far away from England, then come on down to Tropical World and lose yourself in amongst the plants.

places.name: Tropical World

reviews.text:
What a little gem! I didn't know this place existed until I was googling things to do. I took my 2 children aged 9 & 2 and they both had the most amazing day, as did I. The tropical house has so much to see and is far bigger than I ever expected.
The only negative I have to mention is a lot of the glass in the tanks is quite dirty so it can be hard to see the fish but I imagine this isn't an easy job to clean. This aside, we loved everything about it and will definitely be back.
The price is brilliant and even better if you have a max card, 1 adult goes free and under 3's are free too!
We ate in the cafe and food was freshly prepared and tasty, price wise I don't think it was too bad for what you got. Lots of space to eat and you can enjoy your own food in the outside picnic area!
We will definitely visit again.

It's a nice, reasonably priced day out for the kids with a wide variety of different animals from around the world that are well treated and seem happy and some of the birds come right up close.
Just a few empty areas/ displays and only a few butterflies when we were there - but for the price and being council run it was good.
Cafe drinks not overly priced either for a change!

Really lovely place to visit! Bigger than I thought it would be (and than it looked when we first entered). Lots to see, especially good for children, and a good mix of species. Some areas are sloped and are hard to navigate with a manual wheelchair but almost all areas are wide enough to pass through easily and visibility of the animals was good in most areas from a seated position. Would be helpful to have clearer guides/signs along the way for those with visual impairment (route directions, entry & exit signs between the different areas, high contrast on level changes). Caf√© was nice; good variety of food at good prices, plenty of space around tables and lovely outdoor seating (two areas, one overlooking gardens). Would recommend

places.generalDescription: Hyde Park Picture House is a small cinema located in a vibrant student area, offering an array of arthouse and cult films. As one of the oldest cinemas in the country, it holds the distinction of being the world's only surviving gas-lit cinema. Since its opening in 1914, it has been a beloved community cinema, evolving from silent movies to contemporary independent and arthouse films.

sources.snippet: A post shared by Independent Leeds (@independentleeds) on Feb 4, 2017 at 7:21am PST. Take a step back in time with a visit to this charming, independent picture house. Dubbed the cosiest cinema in Leeds, Hyde Park Picture House screens independent and foreign films, along with movie classics and the latest blockbusters, so you‚Äôre sure to find something new and exciting here each time you visit.

sources.snippet: You can experience an "old-fashioned" cinematic experience at Hyde Park Picture House. This is said to be the cosiest picture house in Leeds and retains many of its original features - gas lights, an ornate balcony and piano in the auditorium. It is the only gas-lit cinema still in action in the UK.

reviews.text:
Beautiful wee Edwardian cinema.
Showing a good selection of foreign and more arthouse films.
Not too far from the city centre.
So definitely would recommend to any cinema lovers visiting Leeds.

A well refurbished old cinema. Self guided tour is worthy. Sometimes independent movies. Worthy take a look and long term support.

There is a cafe in the picture house. Or there are food nearby, such as Greek , Korean and Indian, which are open from noon- 11pm, good to have food before or after the movies.
Good price for students to watch movie.

This is a beautifully refurbished picture house. Well worth a visit .  During September (Leeds Heritage Open Days) the picture house is having a heritage trail around this iconic building.   It even has gas lighting in the screening room.

places.generalDescription: Leeds Corn Exchange is a stunning Victorian domed building that houses fashion, lifestyle, and jewellery stores. The area around it offers a mix of sightseeing attractions, cultural experiences, local dining options, and budget-friendly accommodations. The built heritage in the center includes iconic landmarks like Leeds Town Hall, Leeds Civic Hall, and Leeds Central Library. Nearby Kirkstall Abbey provides opportunities for various events throughout the year and houses the Abbey House Museum which delves into Victorian life in the city.

sources.snippet: The beautiful Leeds Corn Exchange is a bustling venue full of independent shops that you can spend time wandering around and browsing. The Victorian brickwork of the corn exchange makes it an iconic landmark in Leeds, and one of the most interesting settings to go shopping. Shops here sell everything from clothes and yarn to vinyls and plants, all offering products that you won‚Äôt find on the high street.

reviews.text: Great place to visit! Interesting independent shops with good gift ideas. There's a seating area where you can buy a warm drink. Would recommend üëçüèª

Oooh, I was pleasantly surprised. I've not been in for some time. I spotted some lovely dresses on the top floor, healing stones, jewellery, and vintage items. You can sit and grab a coffee or freeze a little more with ice cream. It's a cute spot.

Lovely looking historic building.
Well set out and some great little (and I mean little) independent shops over 2 and a half levels.
If you want something a little different and you can't find it here, then you aren't looking hard enough.

places.generalDescription: Leeds City Museum is a captivating destination that offers an immersive journey through the history of Leeds. With its diverse collection spanning natural science, archaeology, heritage, and ancient history, the museum provides a comprehensive look into the city's past. One of its highlights is the Life on Earth gallery, housing an impressive 800,000 specimens. Notably, the museum's iconic tiger exhibit has become a beloved symbol of Leeds' heritage.

sources.snippet: Not too far from the train station, Leeds City Museum gives you and your partner the chance to find out all about the history of this incredible city. There are loads of exhibits to see related to our planet, ancient civilisations, Leeds‚Äô connections to Asia and more. There‚Äôs also an on-site cafe so you can have a sit down with a cuppa and maybe share (or don‚Äôt share, just get your own!) a slice of cake.

The mysterious figures displayed in the theater and scary ghostly running footsteps make this place pretty scary. places.name: Leeds City Museum

reviews.text: Super wonderful! Loved the exhibits - made me excited about Leeds. Wonderful having the thoughts of the visitors through the exhibits. And dress up boxes for the kids! And I had a lovely time sketching at the Sunday Artifacts workshop - fab low pressure art session with great materials and friendly staff.

Leeds City Museum is a standout cultural gem in the heart of the city free to enter, rich in variety, family-oriented, and deeply rooted in local heritage. Its strengths shine in accessibility, architecture, and interactive appeal. While a refresh in certain exhibits and smoother layout flow could elevate the experience, it remains a top choice for locals and visitors alike.

This hidden gem, exceeded our expectations. The area outside is remarkable. Upon entering there was a lovely lady greeting us, more than happy to explain our tour around the museum. I'm guessing she had been stood there all day, but still so happy , showing great passion for her place of work. And rightly so once we made our way round, the place it was exceptional. We are museum geeks, visiting many. This was one of the best. The first floor with the animals, was lovely to see them inside glass protection. You could do a 180 to see all angles, get a real feel of there beauty. There was lots of interaction areas for younger children, my daughter is 12 still enjoyed this experience. As you climb the stairs/floors there was so many wonderful interest different topics. It was a really enjoyable experience, we went as a family , we all enjoyed it. You could easily spend a couple of hours taking in all the marvels. It truly was a surprise inside, do pay this museum a visit. It is tidy, clean & orderly. Definitely one of the best we have visited. No tickets or payment for entrance, donations can be made. Which we did, More than happy to support wonderful places like this .

places.generalDescription: Located near Leeds at Temple Newsam, Go Ape offers an exhilarating treetop adventure for thrill-seekers. With three different obstacle courses reaching heights of up to 15 meters, visitors can dash between trees on zip lines and enjoy stunning views of the estate grounds. The venue caters to all ages, with routes suitable for children as young as four.

sources.snippet: Take a trip out a short out of Leeds to the nearby Temple Newsam and you spend time up in the trees at Go Ape. This is one of the most exciting things to do near Leeds for couples interested in showing off their adventurous sides, as you can take to the treetops on one of the three different obstacle courses. As you climb up to 15 metres high and dash between the trees on ziplines, you can also appreciate the views of the surrounding estate grounds that belong to a 500-year-old country house.

sources.snippet: Go Ape is a unique adventure-activity hidden in the canopy of Temple Newsam. For a date Go Ape can be a bit of a curveball; everyone will experience it differently but we‚Äôre confident that the feelings this activity will emote can pivot between the exhilarating and the damn right nerve racking. sources.snippet: It gets the adrenaline pumping, and it lets you show off your adventurous side to your partner. places.name: Go Ape Temple Newsam

reviews.text:
Absolutely brilliant experience at Go Ape Temple Newsam, Leeds (20/07/205 @14:30)
‚Äì highly recommend you go see it for yourself! The course was exciting and well laid out, and the staff were incredibly friendly, helpful, and supportive throughout, especially on the more challenging sections. A big shout out to Alexandra for encouragement and help on the Tarzi swing ‚Äì you were amazing! Also, thank you to the gentleman who assisted with the Plummet (sorry I didn't catch your name!) ‚Äì your support made all the difference in combating the challenging zips.

My daughter and I really loved every moment of it. Car parking at the location is fairly priced, and they provide handy baskets to keep your keys and belongings safe while you're on the course. Toilets are only a short walk away, A great day out and wonderful memories made!
Brilliant. Probably  8 years upwards.  Different levels of difficulty.  Staff friendly.  Picnic tables available.  Just watching is fun.

My children went on the 13 to 15 year old tree top challenge course my daughter (14) wasn't scared one little bit my son (13) got stuck and scared mid air but I honestly can't praise the staff enough they talked him through the whole thing and was so patient with him they brought him back to the start settled his nerves and he was going for it again from then on because the staff are so patient he did the whole course without problems and he absolutely loved it the staff are amazing thank you so much for giving my son the confidence to carry on and showing him that trust goes a very long way I would honestly highly recommend it to anyone. (one very happy mum and two children).

places.generalDescription: Flight Club Leeds is the city's first social darts experience bar, offering a unique and fun-filled atmosphere. In addition to its fantastic drinks, Flight Club also offers a range of entertaining activities such as bowling, shuffleboard, crazy golf, beer pong, and escape games.

sources.snippet: For something a little more dynamic, Flight Club have somehow updated darts to be‚Ä¶ fun?. Coined ‚Äúsocial darts‚Äù, they‚Äôve created a range of technological, competitive games to choose from and take joy at destroying your date in. sources.snippet: Whether you‚Äôre in the mood for shuffleboard at Roxy Ball Room, electronic darts at Flight Club or prosecco pong (yep, you heard that right) at Boom Battle Bar, you‚Äôre bound to be in for a whale of a time while your completive heckles are up. reviews.text:
Food and drink was incredible.

Owens cocktail mixing was top notch!

Atmosphere is so lively i loved it so so much!!

Darts is a reasonable price pp i 10000% recommend

Try the pizza and the burgers they are to die for!!

Love the decor of this place it's all decorated so well and is very cool. Have been a couple of times and the darts is great fun too, some different games to mix it up though I will say if there's just two of you you probably only need the hour rather than 90 minutes as you get through them quickly not being in a big group!

Staff are friendly and it's just a good experience all round thank you :)

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the charming suburb of Meanwood, Zucco is a contemporary Italian restaurant and bar that has quickly become a local favorite. This inviting eatery, run by brothers Rosario and Michael Leggiero, boasts an aesthetic that combines black and white floor tiles with sleek subway wall tiles and a rustic tin ceiling.

sources.snippet: On the corner of Meanwood Road, this family-run Italian serve a fantastic selection of fresh, handmade Cicchetti, with outstanding wines. Try their ox-cheek, pea and grana padano risotto, or beautiful frangipane, chocolate and pistachio tart. A real neighbourhood gem and a must on our list of Leeds best restaurants.
sources.shortName: Best Restaurants in Leeds, Offers and Events

places.name: Zucco

reviews.text: We came to Zucco on their winter tasting night. We've been a few times and have always been impressed with the tasty food and the friendly staff. Tonight the highlights were the breaded artichoke, bean and whipped ricotta salad and the strawberry sorbet! Every course was really flavourful and there were a couple of treats thrown in! Can't recommend this place enough

This was our first visit to this small italian restaurant in the centre of Meanwood.
The staff were very friendly, helpful and efficient assisting with the nuances of the menu.
The concept is one of sharing your dishes similar to Spanish tapes, so that's what we did.
The food was unusual and delicious with good-sized portions.
An all round great evening and I will certainly be going back.

Zucco isn't just the best restaurant in Leeds, it's arguably one of the best in the country. Great food, attentive (but not over-attentive) service and a lively yet relaxed atmosphere.  Starting with the food, we had several plates shared across the table and each was mouth-wateringly delicious.  A special mention for the arancini which are world-class! Staff are friendly and knowledgeable and the decor in the restaurant is beautiful.  A real gem of a restaurant that deserves every accolade it has received.  A big thank you to all the staff from all of us.

places.generalDescription: The Victoria Quarter in Leeds is a charming blend of old and new, featuring both modern buildings and traditional Victorian architecture. This elegant shopping arcade was designed by Frank Matcham in 1904 and underwent redevelopment in 1990. Inside, visitors are treated to a stunning display of steel and marble decor under its famous stained glass roof.

sources.snippet: For a more laid-back yet equally enchanting date, the Victoria Quarter beckons with its elegant architecture and premium shopping. Stroll through this historic shopping center, window-shopping or picking out gifts for each other. This experience combines the romance of a leisurely walk with the excitement of exploring high-end brands and unique boutiques.

sources.snippet: After checking in, start your day with a leisurely stroll through the Victoria Quarter, Leeds‚Äô most stylish shopping destination. sources.snippet: There‚Äôs also The Victoria Quarter, the luxury shopping mecca which has the largest stained glass roof in Britain. Then there‚Äôs Trinity Leeds, which has over 120 shops and eateries, and of course Briggate, the busy high street.

Guests can indulge in award-winning Yorkshire venison haunch steak, succulent seared pigeon breast, seared fillet of cod with crab and tarragon crust, or clams and mussels with samphire in garlic butter.

An extensive wine list with bottles from all over the world makes this restaurant even more stand-out.

sources.snippet: We‚Äôre about to let you in on Leeds‚Äô best kept secret‚Ä¶ The basement bar and bistro Sous Le Nez. places.name: Sous Le Nez

reviews.text:
My wife and I had lunch and what a lovely meal it was.

As it is a French restaurant I had Fish soup and it didn't disappoint. I have not had Fish soup for a long time and it brought all the memories back from going to France on holiday.

I had Calves liver for my main course and it was beautiful.

The price was good and reasonable.

Would I recommend and return, I definitely would.

If you like my honest reviews please follow me as I review on a regular basis.

Been here a few times over the years and I've never had a negative experience. From start to finish you are always looked after by the staff, the atmosphere is always good and the food is incredible!! Here is my wood pigeon starter, steak (bear in mind this is only their cheapest steak at ¬£25) and creme brulee

This has been an amazing dinner tonight. The menu of the day was an incredible value and for excellent food. My prawn tempura and steak were perfectly presented and both cooked as requested. The dark chocolate fondant was so delicious. My husband had the chicken liver parfait and then Yorkshire pork. Both were just as good as mine. We did dinner with wine which were very good for the price and were nice addition. Cushla and John as well as all staff were professional and wonderful servers. As many new places come and go this restaurant has been around a long time and my only regret is not coming g in sooner. I will certainly be back!

places.generalDescription: Ox Club is an award-winning restaurant located in Leeds city center, known for its grill cooking and elevated comfort food. The menu features a mix of √† la carte, prix fixe, and brunch options with bold and creative dishes such as English asparagus with smoked lamb bacon and cornish sardines with vine leaves.

sources.snippet: Grill restaurant homed in Headrow House, the Ox Club has featured in the Michelin Guide as well as the Good Food Guide, for very good reason!. Amongst a fantastic selections of wines, spirits and cocktails, you'll find a beautifully curated line up of meats, fishes and vegetables, all cooked using their grill style method to give that fantastic smoky taste.

sources.snippet: There are loads of romantic restaurants in Leeds, but we have a soft spot for The Ox Club and it‚Äôs warm, comforting atmosphere. reviews.text:
Could not recommend highly enough. We had oysters from the specials to start, the cote de boeuf as our main and a baked Alaska for desert. The waitress recommended a really nice wine with the food and it was very reasonably priced. Service was the perfect amount of attentiveness.

Absolutely 10/10

Heard about the steak and fries offer for ¬£16 so thought we'd check it out.

Steak is done perfectly to my requested liking, generous portion of chips and their in house made butter complements the meal perfectly.

We also got it with peppercorn sauce which was well made and perfectly seasoned. Service is good too.

First time I came for this and would come again for this deal and possibly to try other things on the menu! Very naturalistic interior and chilled atmosphere too.

Best British food I've ever had! I love all the sauces, seasoning was on point! Their menu changes too.

Didn't have to prebook if you come 6pm, I guess it's early dinner, plenty seats. Great service, waiter gave good recommendations and very friendly, enjoyed our time there very much.

My favourite was the ox heart with oyster sauce, it was an interesting texture that almost didn't taste like heart (I've had chicken heart before) and the oyster sauce was creamy with a hint of oyster, I really enjoy the natural flavour of the ingredients, they were paired and chosen well.

The mutton kofta itself was a bit tough and salty and in my opinion would've been better medium rare. The cherry tomatoes came with it were the best I've had, juicy and good balance of sweet and sour.

The medium rare steak with pepper sauce was great too, we ordered fries on the side. Again the pepper sauce was excellent, it had a spicy kick to it, I'd buy all of their sauces. Steak was done well too.

The basque cheesecake was ok, standard good cake, not too sweet.

places.generalDescription: Bulgogi Grill offers an authentic Korean table-top BBQ dining experience, allowing diners to grill a variety of marinated meats and seafood right at their tables. The restaurant's trendy Asian-style dining room provides a fun and interactive atmosphere for guests to enjoy DIY cooking while savoring the flavors of Korean BBQ. From beef, pork, duck, and squid to delicately seasoned seafood like prawns and various fish options, there's something for everyone to grill and wrap in unlimited rice and lettuce.

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre after a fun, interactive dining experience for your date night, Bulgogi Grill is a must-visit. This Korean BBQ spot lets you cook your own meal right at the table, creating a unique and engaging experience for you and your date. The set menu, priced at ¬£29.95 per person, kicks off with delicious Kimbap and Vegetable Dumplings to start.

sources.snippet: Flex your cooking skills at Bulgogi Grill, a Korean DIY restaurant on Merrion Street. The kitchen will ply you with locally-sourced BBQ meat and seafood, which has been pre-marinated for you to prepare as you wish on your own dome grill.
sources.shortName: Quirky Leeds Date Ideas

places.name: Mommy Mookrata

reviews.text: I came here last year but forgot to give this place its well earned 5-star review. Amazing, fresh food, and big portions. I will definitely be going back. The staff even brought out ice cream on the house for my fianc√©s birthday, and sang a happy birthday song. We really appreciate this place.

I completely understand the restaurant has changed ownership from Bulgogi Grill to now Mommy Mookrata and went into the experience with an open mind, however was sorely disappointed.

Quality of meat was poor. Opted for the beef mixed set only to find the beef grisly and chewy. The broth on the hotpot was relatively flavourless and beyond that the beef itself was plain. The mixed sets come with three dipping sauces of which were just fine, though not to my taste personally. I had to ask for a bowl of plain soy sauce as this didn't come as standard. To add I spent the entire meal with steam from the hotpot blowing in my face as it wasn't picked up by the extractor fan.

Grill was not oiled and so the meat would burn and charr whilst being raw all at the same time, it was almost impressive to see. No oil on the grill made it hard to cook the meat as it would just stick to it, and again the only alternative was the flavourless hotpot broth.

The service was fine. For a ‚Äúsoft launch‚Äù opening of restaurant I would've hoped for a bit more enthusiasm or charisma, but it just felt cold. There was a QR code to scan to access the menu however the website it led to was full of pop ups and adverts making it very slow to load and hard to navigate, if you clicked the wrong link I'm sure a virus would've downloaded on your phone.

Quality of food was subpar. Order a fried rice dish, rice was mushy and overcooked, this was alongside the beef mixed set which again had grisly chewy beef. Only available cutlery is chopsticks making some of the food hard to eat for those who aren't familiar with using them.

To top it all off it was cash only. This was never advertised, not on their website, not on their social media, nowhere. We were only told AFTER eating our meal. We didn't have any cash on us and the ATM outside of the restaurant was broken so had to pay via bank transfer. Transfer was directed to a personal account, not a business account, which I found quite sneaky. Staff showed us a screenshot on his phones photo album with details of where to send payment to, again just very shoddy unprofessional business, especially as cash only was not advertised anywhere at all.

Won't be going again. If you were a fan of Bulgogi Grill, save your money and don't bother. It's a different restaurant now, part of the Mommy Thai chain which is just sad. No heart or soul anymore. I can forgive teething issues for a new restaurant opening, but this whole experience left a literal bad taste in my mouth.

I want to start this review by saying the only reason this isn't a 2* review is because of how understanding and good the staff were here HOWEVER.

I've eaten at bulgogi grill so much that I've forgotten count - it was the best place to get good Korean BBQ. We went into ‚ÄúMommy Mookrata‚Äù with the expectations of Bulgogi grill but the option of hotpot (THIS IS NOT THE CASE)

THE MENU - Menu has completely changed, it's abysmal. Before you would pay for the meats and you would get unlimited sides etc, now you have to either order a set menu like before with ONE PORTION of each side or BUY INDIVIDUAL MEATS/SIDES. Which at first doesn't sound too bad right? WRONG - It's ¬£4.50 for Lettuce leafs which counted as the portion size is drastically different (YOU GET 8 LEAFS) and ¬£3.00 for RICE which is also SMALLER portion.

There's no draft beer, only small 330ml bottles, soju was sold out AND they no longer sell the yellow radish (which is in their kimbab) so it's either they dont care what their customers want OR it's no longer homemade kimbab :|

This place used to be my go-to and now I doubt we'll be going back again. BUT one thing I want to make sure the owners of this restaurant know is that there staff is genuinely one of the only redeeming parts of your restaurant now so hopefully you will understand this isn't on them, it's on you for selling out.

Price for this was ¬£44.95 See pictures below

reviews.text: The creamiest Guinness in Leeds? I've spent 15 years conducting very serious research (purely in the name of science, of course), and I can confirm: Beer Hall @ Headrow pours a pint so smooth it could charm a nun. Perfectly poured, rich, and silky-this is the Guinness dreams are made of. If there's a smoother pint in the city, I'll eat my bar tab. Until then, I'll take another, please‚Ä¶ maybe on the house?"

When you walk past the front of this bar you would never believe what is inside, there were a couple of security people on the front door which is on the main road and then when you walk through you go up a few flights of stairs again extremely quiet and not knowing what to expect but you get to the top where the terrace bar is And again lovely views of the city we have plenty of seating area, perfect for a sunny day with its own terrace bar upstairs, atmosphere was brilliant

Headrow House is a nice venue for Novel Notions, a community book swap, held quarterly at Headrow House.
It's a simple and appealing concept: drop off some of your own books that are surplus to requirements, and get a token per book; then come back a bit later and exchange your tokens for a selection of the wide range of books (fiction and non-fiction) also dropped off by Leeds' bookish community.
Search through forgotten classics, nab a new release or find a new favourite you never knew you just had to read!
Novel Nations happens every few months, always on a Sunday; check out Novel Notions on social media, or the Headrow House website events page.

places.name: The Ivy Victoria Quarter Leeds

reviews.text: We didn't book, but decided to call in here to have a light bite and a glass of Prosecco in the outdoor dining area. The waiter, Jack, came straight over and offered us water. We chatted a little and he asked whether we were celebrating anything, and we told him that it was my birthday and that was our reason for being in Leeds. We explained we are only having a small plate because we have a meal booked later in the day. The food we had was amazing, I highly recommend the crab starter, it's definitely a special dish. We finished our food and asked for the bill. Next, Jack walks over with a desert with a candle in it And it had a little chocolate saying happy birthday on it. I was over the moon and it made my day. I want to thank you so much for your kindness and amazing service. Jack is a credit to the Restaurant (which is absolutely stunning). A Service like this Is memorable for all the right reasons and I will probably never forget his kindness ü©∑ü©∑ü©∑

We visited The Ivy, Leeds on July 16, 2025, to celebrate my daughter's university graduation and had a fantastic experience. The restaurant is beautiful, perfect for a special occasion. I had the prix fixe menu with duck salad, sea bass, side of mashed potatoes and cr√®me br√ªl√©e - all delicious. One of my daughters had the same but chose the chocolate bombe, which was amazing too. Service was top-notch, our server was lovely and super attentive. Even the bathrooms were pretty! Highly recommend!

The Ivy Leeds offers a good dining experience with a delightful blend of great ambiance and fantastic food. The rib-eye on the bone was cooked to perfection, boasting a rich, tender flavor that truly stood out. Paired with the truffle and parmesan chips, which were crispy, indulgent, and packed with flavor, it was a memorable dish. The ambiance of the restaurant was elegant and sophisticated, with a welcoming atmosphere that made the meal even more enjoyable. To top it all off, the service was attentive and friendly, ensuring a seamless dining experience. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a top-notch meal! It was a pricey meal as you have to buy sides separately and the drinks could have been slightly better for the price but that would be my only criticisms.

places.address: Vicar Ln, Leeds, LS1 6BA, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Hyde Park Book Club, established in 2016 within a former petrol station and fancy-dress shop, has evolved into a popular multifunctional venue for music and arts. The team's love for literature, plants, delicious food, and live music is evident in the two venues accommodating 150-capacity and 45-capacity gigs. Hosting diverse artists like Vipertime and Gurriers, the space also features a record label with acts such as Lara Jones and Skwid Ink.

Even if you‚Äôve never had a housemate who DJs here on weekends, it‚Äôs a sweet option for laidback vibes, affordable larger and serious culture points. Hyde Park Book Club, 27-29 Headingley Ln, Leeds LS6 1BL
sources.shortName: Ten top spots for a date night in Leeds

sources.snippet: While you could just go to a pub, other cuter classic spots are Victoria Social, Hyde Park Book Club, and Belgrave Music Hall. The winner, though (probably coming at no surprise), is The East Village. This perfect little cocktail bar has a warm and ambient interior, stocked with board games for some cheeky competition.

places.name: Hyde Park Book Club

reviews.text: First time visit to the venue. Great choice of hot, cold drinks, including beers. Good selection of snacks too. Music venue is a small venue, intimate but has a great atmosphere.
Great cafrand food, although a little expensive for what you get, it was tasty and the staff were great.

A great place to relax, eat and drink, or enjoy a live performance.
It's got a welcoming and friendly vibe.
A good range of food (all veggie or vegan), freshly cooked and always tasty.
Recommended!

places.generalDescription: Kendells Bistro is an authentic French restaurant located in Leeds, offering a charming and rustic ambiance with exposed brick walls, flickering candles, and an open kitchen where Chef Patron Steve Kendell showcases his culinary skills. The menu features classic French dishes such as Canard aux Cassis and Longue de Venaison, showcasing a wide range of delightful flavors. The restaurant's warm candlelit tables create a romantic atmosphere for an exceptional dining experience.

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre seeking a cosy and intimate date night, Kendells Bistro in Leeds is a hidden gem. Located on St Peters Square, this charming French-inspired bistro exudes warmth and character, with rustic wooden tables, soft candlelight, and a welcoming atmosphere perfect for a relaxed, romantic evening. The A La Carte menu offers a variety of delicious, seasonal options that blend classic French techniques with a modern twist.

places.name: Kendells Bistro

reviews.text:
Very traditional internal decor considering its in a modern building.
Food was good quality. Service was nice as well as polite.
We had some of our party arrive late so the waiter explained the timings on food which was helpful.

However as good as the main courses were the complimentary bread whilst we waited was the star showing.
Absolutely beautiful

I'd happily sit with a bowl of soup and a pile of that bread.

As some say it's dark, however it's clear from the pictures the environment is set up like that.

We have ordered tea time set menu. Portion okay even though it is french cuisine. Causal and informal without sacrifice on food quality.

A bit too dark. For people need reading in good light, better read menu before coming.üòÇ

Mood for chatting is fabulous. Staff are nice and well trained.

Kendells Bistro provides a great service, with a warm, cosy and romantic atmosphere. They also moved us to a preferred table when we asked.

However, I personally wasn't overly impressed with the food.
Sadly, two starters weren't available so I went with a third choice of mussels in a garlic and white wine sauce. I think that's a boring dish anyway no matter where you get it from, but the majority of the mussels were out of the sauce so I had to make my way through a few before I could dip them in.

The braised beef cheek was melt in your mouth tender. Excellently cooked.
Generous portion too, but it's a cheap cut of meat so I'd expect that for the price. The flavour was rustic but lacking in anything that got me excited for my next bite. I actually got a bit bored of eating it.  However, to be completely honest, I find beef pretty boring unless it's a steak cut or a burger. Therefore my review is very subjective in that regard and I'd recommend trying it for yourself.

My partner really enjoyed her starter and it was well presented. She liked the beef cheek more than me but she seemed to get my portion of garlic in hers.

So in terms of food rating, we've given it 4 stars to meet in the middle.

I would definitely go to this restaurant again, but I would try the lamb and a different starter.

places.address: 3 St Peter's Square, Leeds, LS9 8AH, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Jackrabbits Pottery in Leeds is a family-friendly paint-your-own pottery studio offering a wide selection of over 130 pieces to choose from, including piggy banks, mugs, and animals. The cozy and inviting atmosphere provides the perfect setting for unleashing your creativity. Whether you're an experienced pottery enthusiast or a beginner, Jackrabbits Pottery welcomes everyone to explore their artistic side.

sources.snippet: Pottery painting at Jackrabbits Pottery is one of the cutest date ideas in Leeds!. There are loads of different pieces of pottery that you can choose to paint, and you can make your pottery into something that represents your relationship if you want a lovely memento from the date!. Imagine how cute that will look in your cupboard at home.
sources.shortName: Date Ideas Leeds: 20 Romantic Things to Do in Leeds [2024]

sources.snippet: For a fun activity for couples, paint your own pottery together!. You can spend a few hours being really creative together as well as taking home wonderful and unique pottery at the end. They will last forever as a memento of your date.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to do in Leeds

sources.snippet: It‚Äôs perfect when you‚Äôre looking for something fun to do with your partner on a rainy afternoon. Choose from shelves of mugs, piggy banks, treasure chests and more, all ready to be painted with your unique designs.

places.name: Jackrabbits Pottery

reviews.text:
Very cute and cosy. A nice activity to do when you want a relaxing Sunday. It's also very therapeutic and calming.

Staff are very sweet and friendly, they explain things well enough for you to be left to your own devices.

I collected both mugs and they came out great!

Would highly recommend!

We recently visited this pottery place to celebrate my birthday, and while the venue itself is beautifully decorated with a great variety of paints and ceramics to choose from, our experience was quite mixed.

Emily, one of the staff members, was absolutely lovely-so friendly, patient, and helpful throughout our session, especially considering we were a large group. I genuinely appreciated her kindness and don't want to take that away from her at all. She was a real highlight of the visit.

However, I was really disappointed by the overall response when we asked for photos. As it was my birthday (and a friend's birthday was coming up too), we just wanted to capture some special moments. Unfortunately, the team made us feel like we were asking for too much. Hazel, in particular, was unfriendly and abrupt from the start and didn't create a welcoming atmosphere.

Even at the end, when we asked for a group photo with what we had painted, Emily said we had to be quick because another group was coming. She took the photo carelessly, and my friend-who was also celebrating-was cropped out. That really upset me. While I truly appreciated Emily's warmth throughout the session, I didn't feel like she made an effort in that final moment, which mattered a lot to us.

It's a lovely place for a casual activity, and there's plenty to choose from creatively-but I wouldn't recommend it for a special occasion. The way we were made to feel, particularly around something as simple as taking a photo, took away from what should have been a joyful experience.
Really loved their late night pottery party, do check it out ü•∞
